activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Contong NMI Vongphakdy

records.addlTxt: 2:45 PM 2022CF000070, 2022CF000085, 2022CF000045 - Defendant Contong NMI Vongphakdy in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Contong NMI Vongphakdy.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt is prepared to enter a plea in 22CF70 and 22CF85 along with requesting another status. Court states the max penalties. Attorney Bartelt stands mute. Defendant will be appearing by zoom. Attorney Bartelt will make the arraignments.
Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:13 AM Prelim in 22CF70 and 22CF85, waivers on file, and status in 22CF45. Defendant Contong NMI Vongphakdy appeared by video from the Richland County Jail.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Contong NMI Vongphakdy.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Prelim waivers have been filed in 22CF70 and 22CF85. At 11:19 a.m., Def joins the hearing in person due to audio issues with the jail connection. Court conducts prelim waiver colloquy with Def. Prelim waivers accepted. Bindover ordered. Arraignment set 9/28 at 2.
Arraignment scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:01 PM Defendant Contong Vongphakdy appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Erickson appear by video specially. The attorney of record is Peter Bartelt. Attorney Harper appears in person. State asks for a $5,000 signature bond. No objection. So ordered. Initial set for 07/20/22 at 1 PM.
